label: 名主
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: Manager and, later, owner of a small amount of land responsible for collecting annual taxes and labor services on myōden. Although commoners, myōshu often held considerable power in the locale, and in the Muromachi period, some became rural warriors (jizamurai).　[名田、地侍]
